ygData.subject: Re: Big races
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually, I am a 33rd level DE sk, and with my reaver I do between 55 and 60 max, my strength with the sword buff is only around 125 or so, now I was grouping
ygData.messageBody:
Actually, I am a 33rd level DE sk, and with my reaver I do between 55
and 60 max, my strength with the sword buff is only around 125 or so,
now I was grouping with a troll SK the other day, and her strength was
near 200, and she was whacking for about 80 points max, now while this
is a hug diffeerence in strength, it does show that it does count.


Tesaar Grimm
Hand of Innoruuk
The Rathe

"Steven E. Phipps" wrote:

> I have yet to see any Noticable Differance from the big races to the
> little races. The big races have more STR and Stamina, and have to get
> agility/dex items. The smaller races gather more of the +STR items.
> Str and Stamina do not seem to have any REALLY great noticable
> effects. I know STr affects attack, etc.. But, has anyone noticed a
> level 40 ogre SK doing far greater Damage than a level 40 DE sk? I
> havent.Course Troll regen is nice for soloing, shrug. Not complaining,
> just STR doesnt seem to have the affect for warrior types as it has on
> other muds or roleplaying games. I guess the slam advantage is ok when
> your fighting casters. Not sure its worth all the racial penalties
> though, heh. Least they got shrink now...8) Morgul
